TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataSource extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a data source in a form template.

remarks.para: A object corresponds to one of the sources of stored data associated with an InfoPath form template. A object can represent either the form template's primary (main) data source, or a secondary data source obtained from some external source of data using an associated data connection (referred to as a data adapter in the first release of Microsoft InfoPath). Working with a form's main data source provides access to the underlying XML document of the form, whereas working with a secondary data source provides access to data retrieved from an external source of data such as a Web Service query.

The object provides properties and methods that can be used to programmatically interact with the stored data, as well as providing access to the associated data connection for secondary data sources. A object can be accessed using the property of the class.

For secondary data sources, a object acts as an intermediary between the form and the data connection that is used to obtain data from an external data source, such as a connection to a Microsoft Access or Microsoft SQL Server database, an .xml file, or an XML Web service. The type of data connection object used depends on the type of external data connection used to acquire the data. The object provides a common set of properties and methods that can be used for all types of data connection objects, and each of the data connection objects provides its own set of properties and methods.
Microsoft InfoPath supports the following kinds of data connections:

item.description: A connection query or submit using ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) represented by the and objects.

A connection to query or submit to an external data source that is registered in the Business Data Connectivity service (BDC) a server running SharePoint Foundation 2010 or SharePoint Server 2010 represented by the or objects.
A connection to query or submit to a SharePoint list represented by the or objects.
A connection to a Web service represented by the object.
A connection to query or submit to an XML file represented by the and objects.
A connection to submit by e-mail represented by the object.

remarks.para: The class corresponds to the DataObject interface in the Microsoft InfoPath 2003 object model.

protected: DataSource();
public abstract System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator CreateNavigator ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator CreateNavigator() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function CreateNavigator () As XPathNavigator
public: abstract System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ CreateNavigator();
abstract member CreateNavigator : unit -> System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator

Docs.returns: An XPathNavigator object positioned at the root node of the data source.

remarks.para: The method allows you to programmatically access and manipulate the stored data of a data source represented by the object. You can use any of the properties and methods that are supported by the XPathNavigator class to work with the data source.
The method replaces the DOM property of the DataObject object used in the Microsoft InfoPath 2003 object model.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: In the following example, an XPathNavigator object is created for the "CityList" data source using the method, and then the XML of the data source is displayed in a message box.
example.code: Dim myNavigator As XPathNavigator = Me.DataSources("CityList").CreateNavigator() MessageBox.Show("Data source XML: " & myNavigator.OuterXml.ToString())

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string GetNamedNodeProperty (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator target, string name);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetNamedNodeProperty(class System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator target, string name) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetNamedNodeProperty (target As XPathNavigator, name As String) As String
public: abstract System::String ^ GetNamedNodeProperty(System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ target, System::String ^ name);
abstract member GetNamedNodeProperty : System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator * string -> string

Docs.param: An object positioned at the XML node corresponding to a nonattribute node in the main data source, for which a named property is to be returned.
The name of the property whose value is to be returned.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of a named property for the specified XML node, which must be a nonattribute node in the main data source.
Docs.returns: The value of the specified named property.

remarks.para: Named properties allow users to associate strings with user-defined properties of XML element nodes in the main data source. Use the GetNamedNodeProperty method to read the value of a named property. The value of a named property can be set by using the method.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

Docs.exception: The parameters passed to this method arenot valid. For example, they are of the wrong type or format.
The parameters passed to this method are a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string Name { get; }
.property instance string Name
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };
member this.Name : string

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the associated object.
Docs.value: If the object represents a secondary data source, returns the name of the data source. If the object represents the primary (main) data source, returns String.Empty.

remarks.para: If the data source is a secondary data source, the name of the object is the same as the name of the data source that it represents. For secondary data sources, the name of the object can also be used as the argument to the property of the class.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: In the following example, the name of each object in the DataSourceCollection is displayed in a message box.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.DataConnection QueryConnection { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.DataConnection QueryConnection
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property QueryConnection As DataConnection
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::DataConnection ^ QueryConnection { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::DataConnection ^ get(); };
member this.QueryConnection : Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.DataConnection

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the object associated with the data source.
Docs.value: A associated with the data source.

remarks.para: After you have set a reference to the object that the property returns, you can use the properties and methods that the particular object provides.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: In the following example, the property of the object is used to return a reference to the data connection that is associated with the object, which in this example is an object. The code then uses the property of the class to display the SQL command text in a message box.
example.code: Dim myConnection As AdoQueryConnection = _ DirectCast(Me.DataSources("CityList").QueryConnection, _ AdoQueryConnection) ; MessageBox.Show("SQL command text: " & myConnection.Command)

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool ReadOnly { get; }
.property instance bool ReadOnly
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReadOnly As Boolean
public: abstract property bool ReadOnly { bool get(); };
member this.ReadOnly : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the data source is in a read-only state.
Docs.value: true if the data source is read-only; otherwise false.

remarks.para: For a object that represents a form's primary data source, if the ReadOnly property is true, data in the form's underlying XML document is in a read-only state and cannot be changed. If false, the data in the form's underlying XML document can be changed.
For a DataSource object that represents a secondary data source, the ReadOnly property always returns false.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

abstract member SetNamedNodeProperty : System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator * string * string -> unit

Docs.param: An XPathNavigator object positioned at the XML node corresponding to a nonattribute node in the main data source, for which a named property is to be set.
The name of the property to be set.
The value to which the property will be set.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a named property for the specified XML node, which must be a nonattribute node in the main data source.

remarks.para: Named properties allow users to associate strings with user-defined properties of XML element nodes in the main data source. The value of a named property can be set by using the SetNamedNodeProperty method. Use the method to read the value of a named property.
Property values set with the SetNamedNodeProperty method are not saved when the form is saved.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.
